channel.title: Havenscape 317 *EDITED* 30/1/2011
channel.description:
I started on a project called Havenscape.
Okay, now there were some things I couldn't do in 508. Like smithing, never seen smithing in any server too. Mining, was supposed to work, but didn't work. Not even a simple animation and give item. Even copying it from another server didn't work. And i figured out 317's are more stable, so I'm going for a 317.
Well, the point of the server is a totally original made good server. Not one of these leeches. And also not one of these servers where you get 50 attack with hitting 10 and where you get a dragon full helm out of level 8 barbarians. No server where i beg for donations. I am making a server that's fun, and won't lose it's fun in 30 minutes of playing.
Currently I am the only one working on it. In-game name: Soal Reaver.
Skills progress:
Green = Finished Blue = In progress Red = Not started yet
Attack Strength Defence Ranging Prayer Magic Runecrafting Hitpoints Agility Herblore Thieving Crafting Fletching Slayer Mining Smithing Fishing Cooking Firemaking Woodcutting
Some pictures:
[IMG]http://img508.imageshack.us/img508/3442/screenshot0003b.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img573.imageshack.us/img573/9523/screenshot0004.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img11.imageshack.us/img11/9007/screenshot0005p.png[/img]

item.title: Havenscape 317 *EDITED* 30/1/2011
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Suggestions

Remove the spamming npcs from home
Remove the skull in corner that says “safe”, and make it so when you enter the wilderness it shows actual wilderness level
Change admin crown

I could help with programming some skills if you’d like, I could also help with lots of other things. If your interested pm me

Read full topic

item.title: Havenscape 317 *EDITED* 30/1/2011
item.dc:creator: @Kono-chan Kono-chan
item.description:
@Kono-chan wrote:

You’re an idiot. The coding in 317’s and 508 are no different. The only thing that’s different is the packets and such. Java is java.

And no, 317’s are not more stable. It depends on the base you’re using, not the revision. Not saying they’re less stable, either.

Read full topic
